projects.name: devwisdom-go
projects.description: Wisdom Module Extraction (Go Proof of Concept) - A standalone Go MCP server providing wisdom quotes, trusted advisors, and inspirational guidance for developers. Extracted from the exarp project as a proof of concept for using compiled languages (Go) for exarp modules.

tasks.name: Phase 1: Core Structure
tasks.details: Complete core project structure including Go project setup, basic types (Quote, Source, Consultation), engine skeleton, config management, advisor registry skeleton, and MCP server structure.

tasks.name: Phase 2: Implement Configurable Sources System
tasks.details: Implement configurable source loading from JSON files instead of hard-coded structs. Includes SourceLoader, project root detection, multiple config file locations, and hot-reloading capability.

tasks.name: Phase 2: Add Caching and Timeout Support
tasks.details: Implement local caching for source configurations with TTL, file modification tracking, and automatic invalidation. Add HTTP client timeout support for API-based sources with retry logic.

tasks.name: Phase 2: Port Wisdom Sources from Python to JSON
tasks.details: Port all 21+ wisdom sources from Python sources.py to JSON format. Sources include: pistis_sophia, stoic, tao, art_of_war, bible, confucius, bofh, tao_of_programming, murphy, shakespeare, kybalion, gracian, enochian, and Hebrew sources (rebbe, tzaddik, chacham, pirkei_avot, proverbs, ecclesiastes, psalms). Also implement random source selector.

tasks.name: Phase 3: Advisor System
tasks.details: Complete advisor system including metric → advisor mappings, tool → advisor mappings, stage → advisor mappings, score-based consultation frequency, and mode-aware advisor selection (AGENT/ASK/MANUAL).

tasks.name: Phase 4: MCP Protocol Implementation
tasks.details: Implement JSON-RPC 2.0 handler, register 5 tools (consult_advisor, get_wisdom, get_daily_briefing, get_consultation_log, export_for_podcast), register 4 resources (wisdom://sources, wisdom://advisors, wisdom://advisor/{id}, wisdom://consultations/{days}), handle stdio transport, and error handling/logging.

tasks.name: Phase 5: Consultation Logging
tasks.details: Implement consultation logging system with JSONL log file format, consultation tracking, log retrieval and filtering, and date-based log rotation.

tasks.name: Phase 6: Daily Random Source Selection
tasks.details: Implement date-seeded random selection for daily source rotation. Ensure consistent daily source (same date = same source) and random source rotation functionality.

tasks.name: Phase 7: Optional Features
tasks.details: Implement optional features including Sefaria API integration for Hebrew texts, Voice/TTS support (Go equivalent of edge-tts), and podcast export formatting.

tasks.name: Phase 8: Testing
tasks.details: Write comprehensive tests including unit tests for wisdom engine, unit tests for advisors, integration tests for MCP server, and testing with Cursor MCP client.

tasks.name: Phase 9: Documentation
tasks.details: Complete documentation including API documentation (godoc), usage examples, migration guide from Python version, and performance benchmarks comparing Go vs Python.

tasks.name: Phase 10: Polish & Deployment
tasks.details: Final polish including error message improvements, logging improvements, performance optimization, cross-compilation (Windows, Linux, macOS), and CI/CD setup.

tasks.name: Port Simple Sources (stoic, tao, bofh, tao_of_programming, murphy)
tasks.details: Port the 5 simplest wisdom sources from Python to JSON format: stoic, tao, bofh, tao_of_programming, and murphy. These have straightforward structures with no special handling needed.

tasks.name: Port Pistis Sophia (separate module with extra metadata)
tasks.details: Port pistis_sophia source which is in a separate Python module (pistis_sophia.py) with additional metadata including chapter, context, and aeon_number fields.

tasks.name: Port Hebrew Sources (rebbe, tzaddik, chacham) with bilingual support
tasks.details: Port 3 Hebrew sources (rebbe, tzaddik, chacham) with bilingual Hebrew/English support. These require special handling for Hebrew text and language metadata.

tasks.name: Implement Random Source Selector
tasks.details: Implement daily random source selector with date-seeded random selection. Same date should return same source (consistent daily source), with random source rotation across days.

tasks.name: Port Medium Sources (7 sources)
tasks.details: Port 7 medium complexity sources: art_of_war, bible, shakespeare, confucius, kybalion, gracian, and enochian. These have more quotes but standard structure.

tasks.name: Create zsh plugin structure
tasks.details: Create zsh/ directory with devwisdom.plugin.zsh main file. Implement helper functions: devwisdom-daily, devwisdom-quote, devwisdom-consult. Add auto-completion support.

tasks.name: Implement CLI briefing command
tasks.details: Implement 'devwisdom briefing [--days DAYS]' command to get daily briefing. Support JSON output format.

tasks.name: Create zsh plugin installation script
tasks.details: Create installation script for zsh plugin. Support both oh-my-zsh and standard zsh plugin directories. Add documentation for installation.

tasks.name: Implement CLI sources and advisors commands
tasks.details: Implement 'devwisdom sources' and 'devwisdom advisors' commands to list available sources and advisors. Support JSON output format.

tasks.name: Implement CLI consult command
tasks.details: Implement 'devwisdom consult [--metric METRIC] [--tool TOOL] [--stage STAGE] [--score SCORE]' command. Support all consultation parameters and output formats.

tasks.name: Implement CLI quote command
tasks.details: Implement 'devwisdom quote [--source SOURCE] [--score SCORE]' command. Support human-readable and JSON output formats. Add quiet mode option.

tasks.name: Phase: Standalone CLI and Zsh Plugin - Foundation
tasks.details: Create CLI structure and entry point. Add cmd/cli/main.go with mode detection (CLI vs MCP server). Implement basic command structure using standard library flag package. Add output formatting utilities.

tasks.name: Update Makefile and documentation
tasks.details: Update Makefile with CLI build targets. Update README with CLI usage examples and zsh plugin installation instructions. Add examples and use cases.

tasks.name: Research Cursor Extension Architecture
tasks.details: Research and document the architecture for a Cursor/VS Code extension to complement devwisdom-go MCP server. Review VS Code Extension API, MCP SDK integration patterns, and Cursor-specific requirements. Document technical decisions and implementation approach.

tasks.name: Phase 1: Extension Foundation (MVP)
tasks.details: Implement basic Cursor extension structure with MCP client integration, status bar with health score, and single command for getting wisdom quotes. Create extension package.json, TypeScript setup, MCP stdio client, and status bar component.

tasks.name: Phase 2: Command Palette Integration
tasks.details: Implement all command palette commands for devwisdom extension: Get Daily Briefing, Consult Advisor, Get Wisdom Quote, View Sources, and View Consultation Log. Add command handlers, output formatting, and error handling.

tasks.name: Phase 3: Sidebar Panel Implementation
tasks.details: Create webview-based sidebar panel with three views: Daily Briefing View (shows today's wisdom quotes), Sources Browser (browse all available sources), and Consultation History (view past consultations). Implement data refresh mechanism.

tasks.name: Phase 4: Notifications & Polish
tasks.details: Implement notification system for daily wisdom quotes, advisor recommendations, and project health alerts. Add extension settings UI, create icon assets, and write extension README for marketplace publication.

tasks.name: Phase 9.2: Usage Examples
tasks.details:
Create comprehensive usage examples demonstrating how to use the devwisdom-go library and CLI.

✅ Completed:
- Created examples/programmatic_usage.go with 7 comprehensive runnable examples
- Updated examples/README.md with programmatic usage section
- Updated README.md with programmatic examples reference
- Verified existing examples (cli_usage.md, mcp_integration.md, add_project_source.go)
- All examples tested and working

Coverage:
- CLI usage examples (comprehensive markdown guide)
- MCP integration examples (complete JSON-RPC examples)
- Programmatic Go API (7 runnable examples)
- Source configuration (working code example)

tasks.name: Research Go task runners (mage vs task) for build system improvements
tasks.details: Research and compare mage and task task runners for Go projects. Evaluate which would be better for replacing or enhancing the current Makefile. Consider: ease of use, Go integration, cross-compilation support, CI/CD compatibility, learning curve, and community adoption. Document findings with recommendations.

tasks.name: Research and implement Go build tags for conditional compilation
tasks.details: Research Go build tags and identify use cases in the project (e.g., platform-specific code, feature flags, debug builds, example code). Implement build tags where appropriate to improve code organization and enable conditional compilation features. Review existing build tag usage in examples/add_project_source.go.
